meanings.definition: A person or thing that classifies or categorizes.
meanings.sent1: The classer organized the books by genre.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used the classer to sort the students' assignments.
meanings.sent3: The classer decided to group the toys by color, making the room look like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: She was a human classer, always putting things in their proper place.
meanings.sent5: The classer was like a walking library, knowing exactly where each book belonged.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used for sorting or organizing items.
meanings.sent1: The classer beeped as it scanned each item at the checkout.
meanings.sent2: The office used a classer to alphabetize the files.
meanings.sent3: The classer at the post office worked tirelessly, never taking a break.
meanings.sent4: The classer hummed along, efficiently arranging the products on the conveyor belt.
meanings.sent5: The classer was like a helpful robot, always making sure everything was in order.

meanings.definition: To assign a rank or grade to someone or something based on quality or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will classer the essays based on content and grammar.
meanings.sent2: She had to classer the fruits as ripe or unripe.
meanings.sent3: He decided to classer the movies by how many explosions they had.
meanings.sent4: The judge will classer the performances from best to worst.
meanings.sent5: The chef will classer the dishes from delicious to mediocre.
